title: [Self-Directed] Technology Acceptance Model (TAM)-Based Design Strategies for Enhancing Acceptance of Vocational Education MOOCs

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Device Utilization Skills and General Interest in Scientific Fields
context.additional_context: Enhancing MOOC utilization skills and educational effectiveness for non-degree-seeking adult learners in science fields.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain the perceived ease of use (PEOU) of a MOOC platform interface at over 80% accuracy.
Learners can apply the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) to analyze the perceived usefulness (PU) of MOOCs in real-world case studies.
Learners can demonstrate the impact of positive attitudes (ATU) and usage intentions (IU) on learning experiences (LE) through project deliverables when utilizing MOOCs.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
